image_requirements.description: Detail shots should highlight all embellishments and design elements on the garment. There should be a minimum of two detail shots for each GTIN. Except for GTINs that have a back detail, you would need only one detail shot.
Include an image of the back view if the garment has a design on the back or a hood. If a back shot is required, the back view should be the SWAV1 image, and only one detail shot is needed.

Shoot the main SW image with shirts placed OVER the pants. When shooting each separate image, shirts are always placed UNDER the pants. Pack of 3 shirts/shorts/pants - style cascading downward; Pack of 4 or more skirts/shorts - style staggered from left to right; Pack of 4 or more pants - style staggered in a diamond shape.

If items come in special packaging or require special dot whacks identifying the number of pieces in pack, please provide that imagery. If updates are made to packaging, vendors must send updated imagery or packaging to shoot.

summary: The page outlines photo direction guidelines for children's apparel, focusing on detail shots, back details, and styling requirements for packaging and image presentation.
